page.title: 16Churches in Meltham Cont/.
page.content:
{St. Mary the Virgin, Wilshaw. Wilshaw{church}was built in{1863}in memory of Mary Beaumont, who died having a baby. Joseph Hirst, her father, was a mill owner and he paid to have the{church}built. Today the {Rev. Mr. D. Turner}holds services there every Sunday morning.
{The Baptist Church, Meltham. The first Baptist{church}was built in{Meltham}in{1820. }The present {church}was built in{1864}and is still used on Sundays, but there is no {minister}living in{Meltham}now.
{The Methodist Church, Meltham. The first{chapel}was opened in {1819.}The new Methodist{chapel}was opened in{1977.}The{minister}is called {Rev.Mr.David Hill.
